name: Fuel
description: The Fuel module provides functions for managing vehicle fuel levels across different fuel systems. It handles getting and setting fuel for vehicles.

clientFunctions.name: GetFuel
clientFunctions.description: Gets the current fuel level of a vehicle.
clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()

-- Get fuel level of current vehicle
local vehicle = GetVehiclePedIsIn(PlayerPedId(), false)
if vehicle ~= 0 then
    local fuelLevel = Bridge.Fuel.GetFuel(vehicle)
    print("Vehicle fuel level: " .. fuelLevel .. "%")
end

clientFunctions.name: GetResourceName
clientFunctions.description: Returns the name of the currently active fuel system.

returns.description: Name of the fuel resource being used

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()

local fuelSystem = Bridge.Fuel.GetResourceName()
print("Using fuel system: " .. fuelSystem)

clientFunctions.name: SetFuel
clientFunctions.description: Sets the fuel level of a vehicle. Some systems add fuel, others set absolute values.

parameters.name: fuel
parameters.description: Fuel amount (0.0 to 100.0 or amount to add)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Fuel type (for systems that support multiple fuel types)

returns.description: New fuel level or nil if vehicle doesn't exist

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()

-- Set vehicle fuel to 75%
local vehicle = GetVehiclePedIsIn(PlayerPedId(), false)
if vehicle ~= 0 then
    Bridge.Fuel.SetFuel(vehicle, 75.0)
    print("Set vehicle fuel to 75%")
end

-- Add 25 units of fuel
Bridge.Fuel.SetFuel(vehicle, 25.0)

notes: Automatically detects and uses the appropriate fuel system
Fuel levels are typically represented as percentages (0.0 to 100.0)
Some fuel systems may add fuel rather than set absolute values
Vehicle must exist for fuel operations to work
Different fuel systems may have varying behaviors for fuel persistence
Some systems support multiple fuel types (gasoline, diesel, electric, etc.)
